meanings.sent1: I need to reorganize my desk to find my pens.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reorganize her closet by color.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reorganize my thoughts is like herding cats.
meanings.sent4: The team had to reorganize their strategy after the unexpected setback.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were scattered, so I had to reorganize them to complete the picture.

meanings.sent1: After the party, we had to reorganize the living room.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to reorganize the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: I had to reorganize my sock drawer after my cat decided to play in it.
meanings.sent4: The storm had caused chaos, but the community came together to reorganize the town.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to reorganize their desks for group work.

meanings.definition: Change the structure or composition of.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to reorganize its departments for better efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The architect had to reorganize the floor plan to fit in an extra room.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the keyboard and reorganized the entire document.
meanings.sent4: The artist reorganized the colors in the painting to create a new effect.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reorganize the ingredients to follow the new recipe.
